summary: The Sakila_actor table contains information about actors in the Sakila film database. It is typically used to retrieve actor details for film-related queries and reports.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each actor.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: The first name of the actor.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: The last name of the actor.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the actor's record.

summary: The Sakila_address table stores information about addresses used in the Sakila database, which is typically for a film rental business. It is used to manage customer and store locations effectively.

columns.name: address_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each address.

columns.name: address
columns.description: The primary address line.

columns.name: address2
columns.description: An optional secondary address line.

columns.name: district
columns.description: The district where the address is located.

columns.name: city_id
columns.description: A reference to the city associated with the address.

columns.name: postal_code
columns.description: The postal code for the address.

columns.name: phone
columns.description: The phone number associated with the address.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the address record.

summary: The Sakila_category table represents different categories of films available in the Sakila database. It is typically used to classify films for easier searching and filtering based on genre.

columns.name: category_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film category.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the film category.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the category record.

summary: The Sakila_city table contains information about cities associated with various countries. It is typically used to reference city names and their corresponding country identifiers in a database.

columns.name: city_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each city.

columns.name: city
columns.description: The name of the city.

columns.name: country_id
columns.description: The identifier for the country to which the city belongs.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the city record.

summary: This table contains information about countries relevant to the Sakila database. It is typically used to reference country names and their unique identifiers in various data operations.

columns.name: country_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each country.

columns.name: country
columns.description: The name of the country.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the country record.

summary: The Sakila_customer table contains information about customers who have made purchases at the Sakila store. It is typically used to manage customer data, track customer activity, and analyze purchasing behavior.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each customer.

columns.name: store_id
columns.description: The identifier for the store where the customer made purchases.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: The customer's first name.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: The customer's last name.

columns.name: email
columns.description: The customer's email address.

columns.name: address_id
columns.description: The identifier for the customer's address.

columns.name: active
columns.description: Indicates whether the customer is currently active (1) or inactive (0).

columns.name: create_date
columns.description: The date and time when the customer record was created.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the customer record was last updated.

summary: The Sakila_film table contains information about films available for rental, including their titles, descriptions, and rental details. It is typically used to manage film inventory and provide insights into rental performance and customer preferences.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary of the film's plot.

columns.name: release_year
columns.description: The year the film was released.

columns.name: language_id
columns.description: The identifier for the language in which the film is available.

columns.name: original_language_id
columns.description: The identifier for the film's original language, if different.

columns.name: rental_duration
columns.description: The number of days the film can be rented.

columns.name: rental_rate
columns.description: The cost to rent the film per rental period.

columns.name: length
columns.description: The duration of the film in minutes.

columns.name: replacement_cost
columns.description: The cost to replace the film if it is lost or damaged.

columns.name: rating
columns.description: The film's rating indicating its suitability for different audiences.

columns.name: special_features
columns.description: Additional features included with the film, such as deleted scenes.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the film record was last updated.

summary: This table represents the relationship between actors and the films they have appeared in. It is typically used to track which actors are associated with which films in the Sakila database.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for an actor.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for a film.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to this record.

summary: This table links films to their respective categories in the Sakila database. It is typically used to categorize films for reporting and querying purposes.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: category_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for the category to which the film belongs.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the record.

summary: This table contains detailed information about films in the Sakila database, including their titles and descriptions. It is typically used for retrieving film-related data for reporting or analysis.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary of the film's plot.

summary: The Sakila_inventory table tracks the inventory of films available in different stores. It is typically used to manage and monitor film stock levels across various locations.

columns.name: inventory_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each inventory record.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The identifier for the film associated with the inventory.

columns.name: store_id
columns.description: The identifier for the store where the film is located.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the inventory record.

summary: This table represents the different languages available in the Sakila database, typically used to categorize films and other media by language. It is useful for querying and reporting on language-specific content.

columns.name: language_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each language.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the language.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the language record.

summary: The Sakila_payment table records all payment transactions made by customers for rentals. It is typically used to track payment history and analyze revenue generated from rentals.

columns.name: payment_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each payment transaction.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.description: The identifier for the customer making the payment.

columns.name: staff_id
columns.description: The identifier for the staff member who processed the payment.

columns.name: rental_id
columns.description: The identifier for the rental associated with the payment.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The total amount paid in the transaction.

columns.name: payment_date
columns.description: The date and time when the payment was made.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the payment record was last updated.

summary: The Sakila_rental table tracks the rental transactions of movies in the Sakila database. It is used to manage and analyze rental activity, including which movies are rented, by whom, and when they are returned.

columns.name: rental_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each rental transaction.

columns.name: rental_date
columns.description: The date and time when the rental transaction occurred.

columns.name: inventory_id
columns.description: The identifier for the specific movie inventory item that was rented.

columns.name: customer_id
columns.description: The identifier for the customer who rented the movie.

columns.name: return_date
columns.description: The date and time when the rented movie was returned.

columns.name: staff_id
columns.description: The identifier for the staff member who processed the rental.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the rental record was last updated.

summary: The Sakila_staff table contains information about the staff members working in the Sakila database. It is typically used to manage staff details, including their contact information and employment status.

columns.name: staff_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each staff member.

columns.name: first_name
columns.description: The first name of the staff member.

columns.name: last_name
columns.description: The last name of the staff member.

columns.name: address_id
columns.description: The identifier for the staff member's address.

columns.name: picture
columns.description: A link or reference to the staff member's picture, if available.

columns.name: email
columns.description: The email address of the staff member.

columns.name: store_id
columns.description: The identifier for the store where the staff member works.

columns.name: active
columns.description: Indicates whether the staff member is currently active (1) or inactive (0).

columns.name: username
columns.description: The username used by the staff member for login.

columns.name: password
columns.description: The hashed password for the staff member's account.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the staff member's record.

summary: The Sakila_store table represents the different stores in the Sakila database, including their management and location details. It is typically used to track store information and manage store operations.

columns.name: store_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each store.

columns.name: manager_staff_id
columns.description: The staff ID of the manager responsible for the store.

columns.name: address_id
columns.description: The identifier for the address associated with the store.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update made to the store's information.
